message_1: What is the chemical equation for the precipitation reaction that occurs when sodium chloride (NaCl) and silver nitrate (AgNO3) are mixed together? How would you describe the appearance of the resulting precipitate?
message_2:
When sodium chloride (NaCl) and silver nitrate (AgNO3) are mixed together, a precipitation reaction occurs, forming silver chloride (AgCl) and sodium nitrate (NaNO3). The balanced chemical equation for this reaction is:

NaCl (aq) + AgNO3 (aq) â†’ AgCl (s) + NaNO3 (aq)

The resulting precipitate, silver chloride (AgCl), appears as a white, solid substance.
